Both HttpUnit and Cactus are excellent tools. Cactus is the more "unit" of
the two, and allows you to test individual methods and objects that depend
on container objects (such as ServletRequest and Session). HttpUnit lets you
simulate a browser and validate the HTML returned from the server. We use
both in our projects. For more info on both these frameworks, you can take a
look at:


Java Tools for Extreme Programming: Mastering Open Source Tools, including
Ant, JUnit, and Cactus
info:
http://www.rickhightower.com/JavaXPToolkit/

buy:

http://www.amazon.com/exec/obidos/ASIN/047120708X/


Nicholas Lesiecki
Technical Team Lead
eBlox, Inc.
(520) 615-9345 x104
Check out my new book!:

  -----Original Message-----
  From: Mats Nyberg [mailto:mn@...]
  Sent: Friday, January 25, 2002 12:59 AM
  To: junit@yahoogroups.com
  Subject: Re: [junit] Servlet Testing


  also : http://httpunit.sourceforge.net

  Kiran Karkera wrote:

the cactus project http://jakarta.apache.org/cactus might be a good place
tostart.ciao----- Original Message -----From:
<arathi.bhaskar@...>To: <junit@yahoogroups.com>Sent: Thursday,
January 24, 2002 10:07 AMSubject: [junit] Servlet Testing
HiCan I do servlet Unit Testing also using Junit. If so, how do I
getstarted?Thanks & RegardsArathi
